name: Andira do Brasil - Identification Key
description: An identification key for 15 species of the genus Andira found in Brazil, based on key morphological features.

features.name: Number of Leaflets per Compound Leaf

entities.name: Andira fraxinifolia Benth.
entities.description: A medium to large tree, prominent in the Atlantic Forest, recognized by its often acuminate leaflets.

entities.name: Andira inermis (W.Wright) Kunth ex DC.
entities.description: A widespread tree, known for its subglobose drupe and insecticidal properties. Leaflets typically acuminate to acute.

entities.name: Andira humilis Mart. ex Benth.
entities.description: A distinctive small shrub or subshrub, typically found in savannas (Cerrado), characterized by rounded leaflets and pubescent lower surfaces.

entities.name: Andira surinamensis (Bondt) Splitg. ex Amshoff
entities.description: A tree found in Amazonia and the Guiana Shield, easily identified by its distinctive large, rugose fruits.

entities.name: Andira legalis (Vell.) Toledo
entities.description: A medium-sized tree, often found in the Atlantic Forest, morphologically similar to A. fraxinifolia.

entities.name: Andira retusa (Poir.) DC.
entities.description: A tree named for its characteristic notched (retuse) leaflet apex, making it easily distinguishable.

entities.name: Andira anthelmia (Vell.) N.F.Mattos
entities.description: A tree from Amazonian forests, sometimes used in traditional medicine, with acute leaflets.

entities.name: Andira bahiensis N.F.Mattos
entities.description: Endemic to Bahia, Brazil, this medium-sized tree often has lustrous, acuminate leaves.

entities.name: Andira cordata N.F.Mattos
entities.description: A tree with distinctive cordate (heart-shaped) leaflet bases and hairy lower leaflet surfaces.

entities.name: Andira cujabensis N.F.Mattos
entities.description: A tree typically found in the Cerrado and Pantanal biomes, characterized by its acuminate leaflets.

entities.name: Andira felippei N.F.Mattos
entities.description: A tree often encountered in humid forests, featuring glabrous and acuminate leaflets.

entities.name: Andira grandiflora N.F.Mattos
entities.description: A large tree with notably large flowers, predominantly found in Amazonia.

entities.name: Andira laurifolia Benth.
entities.description: A tree characterized by its relatively thick, laurel-like leaflets, found across various Brazilian biomes.

entities.name: Andira parviflora Ducke
entities.description: A small tree or shrub, distinguished by its relatively small, often obtuse leaflets.

entities.name: Andira pisonis Mart. ex Benth.
entities.description: A medium-sized tree found in various Brazilian biomes, bearing acuminate leaflets.
